title.narrative: Emergency rehabilitation of productive capacities and livelihoods of households affected by recurrent weather related shocks

description.narrative:
The project’s objective is to restore and reinforce the livelihoods and productive capacities of food insecure farming households through increased agricultural production. The key expected outputs are: improved varieties of irrigated rice, maize seeds and fertilizer have been provided to targeted farmers; enhanced capacities of women in production of high-value vegetables through provision of seeds and improved access to water. The project will target farming households in the affected communities in the Central River Region, Lower River Region.
The total number of people targeted with CERF funding is 30,100.
Total project budget: US$3,266,000 Total funds received to date: US$430,000 Amount requested from the CERF: US$749,979

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

name.narrative: Central River Region, Lower River Region, Gambia

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency rehabilitation of productive capacities and livelihoods of households affected by recurrent weather related shocks

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
